Description: One end of an object of uncertain function: consisting of a thin strip of smooth and polished flint. The corners are rounded at the preserved end, and the edges are smooth and rounded, not sharp. The entire object was manufactured by grinding.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tomb of Qaa, Bears excavator's mark 'Q'
Curator's comments: Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Abydos' I (London, 1902), 8, pl.XV, group marked Q, second from bottom. Compare the similar object in W. M. F. Petrie, 'Abydos' I (London, 1902), pl.XV, among group marked U. Also the polished agate object in W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, pl.VIA, 17.
